citeinfo.title: Thermal Stratification and Mixing on the Bering Sea Shelf

descript.abstract: A classical view of April-August stratification on the Bering Sea shelf is an isothermal inner domain, a two-layer middle domain and a three-layer outer domain: domain boundaries are roughly 50 and 100 m. Based on a data set from 1974 to 1997, we show considerable spatial, intra-seasonal and interannual variability in this picture. The primary physical balance is between solar heating and turbulent mixing by tidal currents and wind.
descript.purpose: To show the workings of Thermal stratification and mixing on the Bering Sea Shelf
